definition: Abba (Aramaic word father)/by ext. God the Father in Christian gospel
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
Abba (Aramaic word father)/by ext. God the Father in Christian gospel

sentences.english: My father and mother, now together.
sentences.chinese: 我的阿爸，和阿妈，现在终于在一起了。

sentences.english: Mongolian national minority's traditional virtue are many, the father teaches me for the generation toward downloading.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古族的传统美德多呀，阿爸教我代代往下传呀。

sentences.english: And that, his father and I sat by the side of his private Diaojiao house and chatted over tea.
sentences.chinese: 他阿爸拉我在自家的吊脚楼前边聊边喝茶。

sentences.english: Xiao Gang's father is the prince of folk singing in his village.
sentences.chinese: 小刚的阿爸是全寨子的山歌王。

sentences.english: Tomorrow morning, I will go to pick some herbs for my father, you can go with me .
sentences.chinese: 明天我要去草原给阿爸采草药，你可以跟我一起去。

sentences.english: Recently, dad is tending to fidget, I know something wrong will happen.
sentences.chinese: 阿爸这几天有些烦躁，我知道会有事情发生。

sentences.english: But you dad and mum will worry about you.
sentences.chinese: 可是你阿爸阿妈会很担心的。

sentences.english: "Abba, Father, " he said, "everything is possible for you.
sentences.chinese: 他说，阿爸，父阿，在你凡事都能。

sentences.english: Abba Father, let me be Yours and Yours alone.
sentences.chinese: 阿爸，天父容许我，单单属于。

definition: (old) grandfather/polite address for an elderly man, or a woman's father-in-law/(Taiwanese) grandfather
(modal final particle similar to 呢[ne5] or 啦[la5])
mile (unit of length equal to 1,609.344 m)/old form of modern 英里[Ying1 li3]
